title: Horrific Bengaluru accident that killed CEO, his family in Volvo sparks debate on road safety - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bengaluru Road Safety Debate Ignited by Family Tragedy

Date: Saturday, 22nd December 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A tragic road accident near Bengaluru claimed the lives of six family members, intensifying discussions around road safety standards and vehicle effectiveness on unsafe roads.

  • The accident involved a Volvo SUV and an Eicher truck on National Highway 48.
  • All six occupants of the Volvo, including CEO Chandram Yegapagol, were killed when the truck overturned onto their vehicle.
  • Debate sparked over the effectiveness of safety features in vehicles compared to reckless driving behaviors.
  • The Union Minister acknowledged a rise in road accidents in India, calling for stricter enforcement of traffic laws.
“This pic is a reminder that being safer on the road is not achieved by a safer car alone. Safe Roads + Safe Driver + Safe Car --> All three are essential for safety.” - DriveSmart

The tragic loss of life in this accident highlights the critical need for improved road safety measures and responsible driving practices.
newTitle: Bengaluru Road Safety Debate Ignited by Family Tragedy

title: PM Narendra Modi receives Kuwait's highest honour, 20th international award by a country - Hindustan Times
summary:
PM Narendra Modi receives Kuwait's highest honour, 20th international award by a country

Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi has been awarded 'The Order of Mubarak Al Kabeer', Kuwait's highest honour, marking the 20th international award he has received from a country.

  • The Order of Mubarak Al Kabeer is given to foreign Heads of State and royal family members to signify friendship.
  • PM Modi dedicated the honor to the people of India and the strong ties between India and Kuwait.
  • Other notable recipients of this award include former leaders like Bill Clinton and George Bush.
  • Last month, PM Modi received Guyana's highest award, 'The Order of Excellence', during a visit to the country.
“I am honoured to be conferred the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Order by His Highness the Amir of Kuwait, Sheikh Meshal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al Sabah. I dedicate this honour to the people of India and to the strong friendship between India and Kuwait,” PM Modi posted on X.

This recognition reflects ongoing diplomatic relations and is part of PM Modi's series of prestigious international accolades.
newTitle: PM Modi Honored with Kuwait's Highest Award

title: With decks cleared for Nitish leadership for 2025 polls, an NDA refrain: ‘Bihar is not Maharashtra’ - The Indian Express
summary:
Nitish Kumar to Lead NDA in 2025 Bihar Assembly Elections

Date: October 2023
Source: Indian Express

In a recent development, the NDA in Bihar has confirmed that Chief Minister Nitish Kumar will lead the coalition for the upcoming Assembly polls scheduled for October-November 2025, dismissing any speculation about changes in leadership.

  • The NDA constituents reaffirm Nitish Kumar's leadership amid discussions of leadership dynamics.
  • Bihar BJP president Dilip Jaiswal emphasized that Nitish will continue to lead in the elections.
  • The NDA plans a comprehensive campaign with Nitish Kumar addressing joint meetings across various districts, starting in January.
  • Other NDA partners in Bihar include Jitan Ram Manjhi’s Hindustani Awam Morcha and Chirag Paswan’s LJP (RV).
  • Historical context shows Nitish's significant role in Bihar politics dating back to 2000.
“The BJP knows that Nitish is indispensable for the NDA... The BJP can only silently wait for him to walk into the sunset,” a state BJP leader remarked.

This clarification from the NDA partners underlines the stability of Nitish Kumar's leadership as they gear up for the elections, marking his enduring influence in Bihar politics.

‘Tried to prevent collision’: Trucker booked for Bengaluru accident that killed 6 in SUV blames another vehicle - The Indian Express
summary:
‘Tried to prevent collision’: Trucker booked for Bengaluru accident that killed 6 in SUV blames another vehicle

Date: Saturday

Source: Local News

The Bengaluru rural district police are investigating a tragic accident involving a container truck and an SUV that resulted in the deaths of six family members, including a software company CEO and his two children.

Key Points:

  • The accident occurred near Nelamangala when a truck's container fell onto the Volvo XC90 occupied by Chandram Yegapagol and his family.
  • The truck driver, Arif, claims a blue car abruptly braked, causing him to lose control.
  • Police have secured CCTV footage that seems to support the truck driver's statement.
  • All six victims, including Yegapagol’s wife and children, were on their way to their native village.
  • The family was well-prepared for safety, with Yegapagol recently purchasing the Volvo for its safety features.
  • The incident has garnered significant local attention due to the family’s prominence and their tragic loss.
“Safety was a priority for him. He checked many vehicles before deciding on the Volvo.” - Umesh Murudi, relative

This devastating event highlights the risks associated with road traffic and the importance of driver awareness. The investigation continues as authorities search for the driver of the blue car involved.
newTitle: Trucker Involved in Bengaluru Accident Blames Another Vehicle for Fatal Crash

What's Getting Cheaper And Costlier After GST Council Meeting? Check Full List - News18
summary:
What's Getting Cheaper And Costlier After GST Council Meeting? Check Full List

Date: December 22, 2024 Source: News18

The GST Council's 55th meeting led by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman reviewed and made significant changes to GST rates, impacting various goods and services.

  • Reduction in GST on Fortified Rice Kernel (FRK) to 5% to enhance affordability.
  • Full GST exemption on gene therapy to improve accessibility.
  • Exemption for contributions to the Motor Vehicle Accident Fund from GST.
  • No GST on transactions involving vouchers.
  • No GST on penal charges levied by banks and NBFCs for non-compliance.
  • Reduction in pre-deposit for appeals regarding penalty amounts.
“The GST Council aims to provide relief to individuals and streamline compliance,” remarked Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

This meeting signifies an effort to enhance the economic landscape by adjusting tax rates strategically to support various sectors.
newTitle: What's Getting Cheaper And Costlier After GST Council Meeting? Check Full List

title: Narendra Modi in Kuwait: PM receives guard of honour on Day 2, lauds India's ties with Gulf nation - Hindustan Times
summary:
Narendra Modi in Kuwait: PM receives guard of honour on Day 2, lauds India's ties with Gulf nation

Publication Date: Recent

Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a ceremonial welcome and guard of honour during his official visit to Kuwait, marking the first visit by an Indian PM to the country in 43 years. His discussions with Kuwaiti officials emphasized the bilateral ties, economic partnerships, and cultural connections between the two nations.

  • Modi's visit was at the invitation of the Emir of Kuwait, Sheikh Meshal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah.
  • He met with the Indian diaspora and participated in cultural and business discussions.
  • Trade and commerce highlighted as key aspects of India-Kuwait relations.
  • Modi emphasized India's growing economy and the presence of 'Made in India' products in Kuwait.
  • He discussed the importance of the Indian community in Kuwait and its contributions to bilateral relations.
“Overall, the bilateral ties are progressing well and if I could say, scaling new heights.” - PM Narendra Modi

The visit aims to strengthen historical ties and explore opportunities for future cooperation in trade, investment, and cultural exchange.
newTitle: Narendra Modi in Kuwait: PM Receives Guard of Honour and Highlights India's Ties

title: Key question remains unanswered in Mumbai harbour accident - Hindustan Times
summary:
Key Question Remains Unanswered in Mumbai Harbour Accident

Date: December 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses the tragic incident in Mumbai harbour where a Navy boat collided with a tourist ferry, resulting in the loss of 15 lives. Key questions remain regarding the failure to use safety protocols that might have prevented the accident.

  • The collision involved a rigid-hull inflatable boat (Rhib) crashing into an overloaded ferry, the “Neel Kamal.”
  • The investigation raises concerns about why the crash stop button was not activated by the boat's driver.
  • Preliminary findings indicate the ferry was overloaded, carrying 107 passengers instead of the allowed 84.
  • The navy chief is reviewing safety procedures following the incident.
  • This incident follows a previous naval accident in July involving the guided missile frigate INS Brahmaputra.
“These questions can only be answered by the chief petty officer, who was driving the boat and is currently in the ICU.”

The inquiry continues as officials seek answers to the crucial questions surrounding this tragic event and its safety implications.
newTitle: Key Question Remains Unanswered in Mumbai Harbour Accident

title: How heroic 20-year-old saved 30 burn victims of Jaipur LPG tanker blast - Hindustan Times
summary:
Heroic 20-Year-Old Saves 30 Burn Victims of Jaipur LPG Tanker Blast

December 22, 2024, 02:30 PM IST

In a horrific incident, an LPG tanker collision on the Jaipur-Ajmer highway led to a massive fire, leaving around 30 people severely burned. The victims, unable to reach nearby Kandoi Hospital due to an eight-foot wall, found help from a 20-year-old local resident, Rakesh Saini. Using a ladder, Saini helped the victims scale the wall and reach the hospital for treatment.

  1. LPG tanker collision caused a massive fire, injuring around 30 people.
  2. Victims struggled to reach Kandoi Hospital due to an eight-foot wall.
  3. 20-year-old Rakesh Saini helped burn victims over the wall using a ladder.
  4. Dr. Raman Kandoi and his wife provided initial treatment and transported victims to SMS Hospital.
  5. The death toll rose to 14, with over 30 undergoing treatment.

“They were begging for clothes, water... anything to ease their pain,”

- Bhanwar Lal, family head

The heroic act of Rakesh Saini and the timely medical intervention saved many lives in this tragic incident.
newTitle: Heroic 20-Year-Old Saves 30 Burn Victims of Jaipur LPG Tanker Blast

title: Singer Mubarak Al Rashed sings Saare Jahaan Se Accha at PM Narendra Modi's community event in Kuwait. Watch - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mubarak Al Rashed Performs at PM Modi's Community Event in Kuwait

Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Kuwait singer Mubarak Al Rashed performed the patriotic Indian song Saare Jahaan Se Accha at Prime Minister Narendra Modi's community event, #HalaModi, held at Shaikh Saad Al Abdullah Indoor Sports Complex in Kuwait. This event marks PM Modi's first visit to Kuwait in 43 years.

  • Mubarak Al Rashed expressed pride in the strong relationship between Kuwait and India.
  • The event was part of PM Modi's two-day visit to Kuwait.
  • PM Modi's visit was warmly welcomed by officials, including Kuwait's Deputy Prime Minister.
"He (PM Modi) spoke about my country, Kuwait. He spoke about the relationship between the two countries... I feel proud of being Kuwaiti. He asked Kuwaitians to visit India..." - Mubarak Al Rashed

The meetings held during this visit aim to shape a futuristic partnership benefiting both countries and the region.
newTitle: Mubarak Al Rashed Performs at PM Modi's Community Event in Kuwait

Stepwell, Likely 150-Year-Old, Discovered During Excavation In UP's Sambhal - NDTV
summary:
Stepwell, Likely 150-Year-Old, Discovered During Excavation In UP's Sambhal

Date: December 24, 2024, Source: NDTV

An excavation team has uncovered a stepwell in Sambhal district that is estimated to be over 150 years old.

  • The stepwell, or 'baoli', covers an area of 400 square meters and contains four chambers.
  • District Magistrate Rajendra Pensiya confirmed the structure's existence and noted its marble and brick floors.
  • The excavation started after a public meeting brought attention to the potential structure underground.
  • The Municipal Corporation plans to restore the stepwell as more information about it becomes available.
  • An Archaeological Survey of India team also conducted a survey in the area, inspecting multiple shrines and wells.
"The structure is fully covered in mud, the Nagar Palika team is removing the topsoil." - Rajendra Pensiya

The discovery of the stepwell highlights the historical significance of the area and efforts are underway for its restoration and further exploration.
newTitle: Stepwell Over 150 Years Old Discovered in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh

A tragic incident occurred when a four-year-old boy was killed by a speeding car driven by a 19-year-old in the Wadala area of Mumbai. The driver, Bhushan Gole, was arrested but wasn't under the influence of alcohol.

  • The child was playing on the road when he was struck.
  • Bhushan Gole was reversing his Hyundai Creta when the accident happened.
  • The victim's family lives on the footpath and struggles financially.
  • This incident follows another deadly accident in Kurla earlier in December that raised concerns about road safety.
According to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, 1,78,000 lives are claimed by road accidents every year in India, with a significant number being young adults.

This incident highlights ongoing issues related to traffic safety in Mumbai and Maharashtra, pointing to an urgent need for improved road safety measures.

A four-year-old boy, Ayush Laxman Kinvade, has tragically lost his life after being struck by a speeding car driven by a teenager in Mumbai. The accident occurred near Ambedkar College in Wadala.

  • The driver of the vehicle, Sandeep Gole, is a 19-year-old resident of Vile Parle.

title: 'Systematic conspiracy': Kharge slams Centre after election rule tweaked - The Times of India
summary:
Kharge Accuses Centre of Election Rule Manipulation

Date: October 1, 2023

Source: Times of India

In a response to recent amendments made by the Election Commission to electoral rules that restrict public access to certain documents, Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge has condemned the changes as a systematic conspiracy to undermine the integrity of the Election Commission.

  • The Union law ministry amended Rule 93(2)(a) of the Conduct of Election Rules, 1961.
  • The changes limit public inspection of election-related documents, including CCTV footage from polling stations.
  • Kharge claims this is a frontal attack on democracy and the Constitution.
  • Kharge vows to take steps to safeguard electoral integrity and transparency.
  • Congress plans to challenge the amendment in court.
  • The Election Commission argues the changes are necessary for voter privacy and safety.
“The Modi government's calibrated erosion of ECI's integrity is a frontal attack on the Constitution and Democracy.” – Mallikarjun Kharge

This controversy raises significant concerns about electoral transparency and the independence of the Election Commission in India, with the Congress party actively seeking legal recourse against the new regulations.
newTitle: Kharge Accuses Centre of Election Rule Manipulation

title: Who ‘killed’ Atul Subhash? Marriage laws plagued by rotten ecosystem & corrupt stakeholders - ThePrint
summary:
Who ‘killed’ Atul Subhash? Marriage laws plagued by rotten ecosystem & corrupt stakeholders

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: ThePrint

This article delves into Section 498A of the Indian Penal Code, its misuse amid matrimonial disputes, and the broader implications on marriage laws, illustrated by the tragic case of Atul Subhash.

  • Section 498A addresses cruelty against women in marital relationships, allowing criminal charges against husbands and their relatives.
  • Allegations of misuse of Section 498A have led to increased scrutiny, with many asserting that it is often weaponized in divorce and settlement negotiations.
  • NCRB data highlights a significant number of cases recorded under this provision, raising concerns regarding acquittal rates and false reports.
  • Legal experts advocate for reforms to differentiate between genuine and frivolous cases while addressing systemic gender inequalities.
  • The article also discusses personal anecdotes highlighting both victims’ struggles and the legal complexities surrounding such disputes.
“How can you address the question unless you look at each one of these institutions?” - Senior Advocate Indira Jaising

In conclusion, the article emphasizes the need for comprehensive reform in marriage laws to protect the rights of women while preventing misuse of provisions like Section 498A.
newTitle: Who ‘killed’ Atul Subhash? Marriage laws plagued by rotten ecosystem & corrupt stakeholders

title: In view of intense cold in Kashmir, CM Omar Abdullah cancels all programmes in Jammu - Greater Kashmir
2024 Round-Up| Constitution Bench Decisions Of Supreme Court - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
2024 Round-Up: Key Supreme Court Decisions on Constitutional Issues

Date: 2024

Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court held several Constitution Benches in 2024 to address critical nationwide socio-legal issues with significant implications.

  • 12 Constitution Bench judgments delivered, including three 9-judge, three 7-judge, and six 5-judge bench verdicts.
  • Electoral Bonds Scheme Declared Unconstitutional: The scheme violates the right to information; majority judgment authored by CJI DY Chandrachud.
  • No Automatic Vacation Of HC Stay Orders: Overturned previous mandates on interim orders' expiry after six months.
  • Legislative Privileges Don't Protect MPs/MLAs From Bribery: The court clarified that bribery is complete upon acceptance of a bribe, irrespective of subsequent actions.
  • State's Power To Tax Mineral Rights: States can levy taxes on mineral rights independent of Union laws.
  • Permissibility Of Sub-Classification Within Scheduled Castes: States can create separate quotas for more backward groups within SCs.
  • Validity Of S.6A Of Citizenship Act Recognizing Assam Accord: Upheld the constitutional validity of the provision recognizing the Assam Accord.
  • Power Of States To Regulate Industrial Alcohol: Industrial alcohol falls under the definition of 'intoxicating liquor'.
  • Holder Of LMV Driving License: No separate authorization needed for driving certain transport vehicles.
  • Eligibility Criteria Can't Be Changed Mid-Recruitment: Rules for selection cannot be altered once the recruitment process has started.
  • Minority Status Of Aligarh Muslim University: Overturned a past judgment; AMU's status as a minority institution will be reconsidered.
  • Unilateral Arbitrator Appointment Clauses In Public-Private Contracts: Such clauses are deemed invalid.
“The offence of bribery is complete at the point in time when the legislator accepts the bribe.” - CJI DY Chandrachud

This year marked a historic period for the Supreme Court, shaping legal precedent on many critical issues impacting governance, representation, and rights in the country.
newTitle: 2024 Round-Up: Key Supreme Court Decisions on Constitutional Issues

Country facing acute shortage of doctors: Supreme Court orders special NEET counselling round - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Country facing acute shortage of doctors: Supreme Court orders special NEET counselling round

Published on: 22 Dec 2024, 5:34 am

India is currently experiencing a significant shortage of doctors, prompting the Supreme Court to instruct the Medical Counselling Committee to initiate a special counselling round aimed at filling vacant medical seats for NEET undergraduate courses.

  • The Supreme Court emphasized the urgent need to fill vacant medical seats due to the critical shortage of doctors in the country.
  • A special counselling round will be conducted to ensure that no precious medical seats go unfilled.
  • The Court directed that the admissions process should be completed by December 30, 2024, without any exceptions.
  • Direct admissions by colleges are prohibited; all admissions must go through State Admission Authorities.
  • The special admission process will not impact already finalized admissions and will only consider waitlisted candidates.
  • Vacant NRI seats will be converted into general category seats to be filled through State Admission Authorities.
"Taking into consideration the peculiar facts and circumstances...the precious medical seats should not go in waste...we are inclined to extend the period by way of a last chance."
newTitle: Supreme Court Orders Special NEET Counselling to Address Doctor Shortage

title: 25 Notable Supreme Court Judgments Of 2024 On Bail & Arrest - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
25 Notable Supreme Court Judgments Of 2024 On Bail & Arrest

Publication Date: 2024 | Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court delivered several notable judgments in 2024 regarding bail and arrest powers, emphasizing personal liberty and the right to a speedy trial amidst lengthy incarcerations.

  • Judgment 1: UAPA – Mere Delay In Trial No Ground For Bail When Grave Offences Are Involved.
  • Judgment 2: Verdict In 'KA Najeeb' Upholding Right Of UAPA Accused For Bail On Ground Of Delay In Trial.
  • Judgment 3: Illegal Arrest and Remand Cannot Be Validated By Filing of Chargesheet.
  • Judgment 4: ED Cannot Arrest Accused After Special Court Has Taken Cognizance Of PMLA Complaint.
  • Judgment 5: Bail Cannot Be Denied Based On Expedited Trial.
  • Further judgments emphasized that 'bail is the rule, jail is the exception' even in special laws and highlighted procedural proprieties that need to be observed by judicial authorities.

“Bail is the rule, jail the exception.” – Supreme Court

This year's judgments signify a pivotal shift in ensuring the protection of individual rights and liberties in the context of criminal law and justice.
newTitle: 25 Notable Supreme Court Judgments Of 2024 On Bail & Arrest

title: India can never permit others to have a veto on its choices: EAM Jaishankar - The Hindu
summary:
EAM Jaishankar: India Will Not Permit Others to Veto Its Choices

Date: December 22, 2024 Source: The Hindu

External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar reaffirmed that India will not allow external entities to dictate its choices. Speaking in a video message, he stressed the importance of India's cultural heritage and its role in a globalized world.

  • Jaishankar emphasized that India must advance while preserving its cultural identity.
  • He acknowledged the significant influence of India on the global stage.
  • The awards Jaishankar received highlight public and community leadership with a focus on spiritualism.
  • He pointed out the disconnect many have felt between modernization and tradition.
  • Jaishankar called for a deeper appreciation of India's heritage among its youth.
“Independence should never be confused with neutrality. We will do whatever is right in our national interest and for global good without being intimidated to conform.” — Dr. S. Jaishankar

Jaishankar's remarks come as India stands at a significant crossroads in its development and international relations, balancing heritage with modernity.
newTitle: EAM Jaishankar: India Will Not Permit Others to Veto Its Choices
